reviews.positive_text: Location is great, very central and not to far to walk from Place Verdun which is where the bus from the airport arrives and departs.  The bed was comfortable, bathroom and toilet fine and clean but we could really have done with some more light. Breakfast buffet offered a good choice - unfortunately we didn't have the time to really appreciate it.
reviews.negative_text: Our room was fine except for the lighting.  Really needed to be able to turn on some more light!  There's no central ceiling light, low level lighting in the room supplemented by lamps either side of the bed.  Really needed another lamp.

reviews.positive_text: The location was great, close to all the historic sites and a short walk to the beach. Lots of restaurants within a 5 mins walk. Staff were lovely and super friendly.
reviews.negative_text: The first night we struggled to sleep as the room was too hot. We tried decreasing the temperature on the control unit but it would not stay down. In the morning we realised the radiator was on and after a lot of googling we realised it was heating only (there‚Äôs no cooling). After this we kept the radiator off and opened the window at night and we were able to sleep well after this. I mention this anecdote because if we had stayed in the summer we definitely would have struggled to sleep in the heat. This was our only issue with the hotel.

reviews.positive_text:
Location. Nice view from the window.
Parking 2 minutes walk. But  don't pay for parking at the hotel, paying for parking in the parking lot is cheaper (free parking at night).
reviews.negative_text:
1. Payment rules. Prior to arrival, the hotel debits the amount of 50% of the cost of the stay from the bank card. The deducted amount is not taken into account when paying for accommodation. The debited amount was refunded a month later. 
On 01/05/2023, The Hotel deducted  214  from my bank card (booking cost 460,28 euros).
On 02/05/2023, when check-in, the amount of 460.28 euros was debited from the bank card, explaining that 214 euros is a blocking, which will be canceled the next day after the check-out.
But the debited 214 euros were returned to my account only on 31/05/2023.
In total, the hotel used my money for 30 days without any compensation and apologies.

2.  The room is small and there is no place for suitcase and things. No hanger for jackets and raincoats.

3. Discomfort in the rooms. The door to the toilet opens inward and rests against the toilet when opened. It is very difficult to close the door while inside the toilet.

reviews.positive_text: Lovely design and great service from the staff.
reviews.negative_text: The hotel is very central and well located but is in a very busy location so there is a lot of noise from the port and the restaurant street through the night.

reviews.positive_text: Very central, right next to the iconic towers and with bars and restaurants on the doorstep. Friendly and helpful staff. Large public parking lot just around the corner.
reviews.negative_text: I was allocated a room right next to the lift (the second time this has happened on this trip) and I had to pay extra for a different room. That one was quieter, but anyone over about 5ft tall, like me, would not be able to stand in the shower, which is under a sloping roof. Otherwise the hotel is nice.

reviews.review_title: We enjoyed our stay & would stay again but ask for a bigger room.
reviews.positive_text: The location was excellent with cafes & bars, places of interest. The staff were very pleasant & very helpful especially Jordan. The hotel is modern & chic. The breakfast is extra but very good & plenty of choice.
reviews.negative_text: Our room was VERY small, there was a lot of black paint which made it feel smaller. The shower was dreadful, the temperature kept fluctuating & got extremely hot!

reviews.review_title: Great location. Friendly staff. Very disappointing room with many (fixable) flaws.
reviews.positive_text: Perfect location right by the harbour. Clean and stylish interior with friendly staff. Comfortable bed.
reviews.negative_text: We had the deluxe harbour view room. It was quite small, but had 4 issues, which many reviewers have been pointing out for years, but nothing has been done. #1 The bed is huge. It takes up most of the room, so you have to 'shuffle' around it. #2 lack of hooks and storage space #3 that beautiful view is hard to fully appreciate due to huge heavy curtains hanging in front which have to be lifted up and over the top of the window every time you open it, and even then, they still get in the way. Just install a roller blind instead. #4 The shower! It is ridiculous that the holder for it is below knee level. You have to squat in the bath and hold it over your head whilst juggling your shampoo/shower gel in the other hand. It's also cylindrical, so when you rest it in the bath to grab a bottle of shampoo or whatever, the water goes everywhere (see pic of shower holder). In addition, the extractor fan in the bathroom did not work. The air conditioning was broken, and 2 of the lamps in the room did not work. The desk was tiny, and there was only one uncomfortable seat in the room.

reviews.positive_text:
I enjoyed my stay so much I'm already planning on going back to La Rochelle just to stay there again. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was incredible and my room was perfect : clean, quiet and with great aircon. I was on a work trip and it was also great to be able to use their co-working space. The location was so central I never had to walk more than 15 minutes to where I wanted to be.
I would point out that the port-facing rooms look out over some busy restaurants. I'm a very light sleeper and asked whether the room was quiet when I arrived. The staff said they'd put me in a port-facing room as I was staying for a long time and so that I could wake up and see the iconic towers (very thoughtful!). They had no problem in moving me to a courtyard facing room which was perfect for me.

reviews.review_title: A Great Hotel surrounded on a great atmosphere
reviews.positive_text:
Lovely clean and modern room. Beds were very comfortable and we had a great, much needed, nights sleep! Although you're right in the thick of it we heard VERY minimal to no noise at all. Service was friendly and helpful. We loved the breakfast lay out and they had good food options to suit everyone. 

Parking isn't onsite, however, there is parking a 2 min walk away in Parking Vieux-Port Ouest and its the cheapest. We were there for roughly 24 hours and it came to 8 Euros. 

I would definitely stay here again if we were to visit La Rochelle on the future.

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable and relaxing in a great location in town
reviews.positive_text:
Location is superb, we had a room overlooking the main turrets into the harbour. We had breakfast one morning in the hotel but you are also in the town itself and there are a few places open for breakfast if you ant to go out.
Also the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble.

reviews.review_title: Loud Lift noise in room, staff couldn't move us. had to leave..
reviews.positive_text: On arrival the staff were very helpful and the hotel reception and general presentation was excellent, we were looking forward to a nice stay for a couple of nights right near the harbour and right in the centre of La Rochelle.
reviews.negative_text:
Unfortunately on arrival at our room we were very disappointed as the room provided was right next to the lift doors on the floor, the room was small as a cosy room, which I would have been happy to overlook due to the location etc. after staying in the room for a few minutes we realised that every time the lift was used you could hear the motor and the sound of the lift talking as it announced the floors, and if the lift was opening on our floor it was even louder. 

We went to complain hoping to be moved to a new room within the hotel, the first member of staff seemed less than sympathetic and said the hotel was full so she couldn't move us, so we asked to speak to the manager who informed us that he couldn't move us as there were no rooms left in the same price range. 

He said we could pay 200 euros extra a night for a suite that was available or after we refused this offered a family room for an extra 50 euros a night. as we were getting nowhere with this we asked for a refund and at this point the manager did agree and asked us to please vacate the room quickly so he could clean it for resale.

He did return my money and we left as mentioned this was a great shame and a great inconvenience to us..

The room as really small, there was dust on several surfaces, shower wash in an inaccessible fixed position and no plug for the bath!
The shampoo/wash lotion in the bathroom.

reviews.positive_text:
Alle Zimmer sind unterschiedlich eingerichtet. Zuerst erhielten wir ein Zimmer mit Badewanne zum Duschen. Unser Wunsch an der Rezeption, ein anderes Zimmer mit begehbarer Dusche zu bekommen, wurde gleich am darauffolgenden Tag erf√ºllt. Die Zimmer sind sch√∂n eingerichtet, die Aussicht auf den Hafen war wundervoll. In den Stra√üen war bis sp√§t in die Nacht, viel los. Durch die gut abgedichteten Fenster bekam man davon kaum etwas mit. Das Personal an der Rezeption war sehr nett und zuvorkommend. 
Die Lage des Hotels k√∂nnte kaum besser sein. Es gibt 2 Ausg√§nge, eine zum Hafen, eine zur Fu√üg√§ngerzone. Auf beiden Seiten finden Sie direkt neben dem Hotel sehr leckere Restaurants. Sehr empfehlenswert sind unter vielen anderen das Restaurant Iseo, oder Les Flots, Mertensia Ostrateka Kraken, ... Rechts neben dem Hotel befindet sich direkt ein sehr guter Eiswarenladen. In der breiten Baumallee mit den Verkaufsst√§nden a√üen wir nur einmal in einer Pizzeria. Die Speisen waren recht gut. Trotzdem war uns zuviel Rummel hier. Besser Sie gehen in die hinteren Viertel, z.B. das Saint-Nicolas, oder Sie schlendern durch die Stra√üen um die Markthallen, wo es auch sehr leckere Restaurants und interessante Weinlokale, Kunstgalerien und Kleinl√§den gibt. Auf der Place de Verdun m√ºssen Sie einen Abstecher im Caf√© de la Paix machen. Einfach nur pr√§chtig, und lecker zugleich.
Der Strand "Plage de la concurrence" gefiel uns am besten, auch die Promenade sowie der anliegende Park.
Ein weiteres Highlight f√ºr Touristen ist die M√∂glichkeit, Gebrauch von den Ausleihfahrr√§dern "Y√©lo" zu machen. Nach Anmeldung k√∂nnen Sie fast alle 100 m ein Fahrrad ausleihen oder zur√ºckgeben. 0,50 ‚Ç¨ f√ºr 30 min. Wenn man l√§nger ausleiht, wird es g√ºnstiger. E-Bikes kosten ungef√§hr das Doppelte. An sich braucht man aber keins, da alles flach ist. Mit den 3 G√§ngen ist man gut bedient.
